column4: i'm having trouble connecting to X from any tty other than 7 (which is gnome) can someone help me fix it?
where is the file that's used by the startup launcher in gnome?
well system > preferences >sessions... in the gnome menu
MY apologies.  I cannot find the config file right now.
i can't seem to find anything related, but im not sure what i'm looking for lol any tips?
The general X sesssion is in .xsession, but I would look in ~/.gnome2 first.  I'll look for it again.
the problem is that when i try to run azuerus throught DISPLAY=:0 /usr/bin/azureus i get an error saying that connection was refused to the xserver
Ah: that sounds like an x permissions error.  The method I used to use for that is widely considered harmful, and I haven't found a new one.  I probably can't help with that.  Sorry.
your method for solving the permissions problem
Some old docs that came with SunOS 4.1.4: it's not useful current information.
